# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

```julia
function wrap_string(text, text_width::Int = 10)
    lines = []
    for word in split(text)
        if length(word) + length(lines) >= text_width
            push!(lines, "")
        end
        push!(lines, word)
    end
    return join(lines, "\n")
end

# Example usage:
text = "This is a very long string that needs to be wrapped into multiple lines. The maximum line length should not exceed 10 characters."
print(wrap_string(text))
```

This function splits the text into words and then iterates over them, adding each word to a new line if it would cause the current line to exceed the specified `text_width`. The `split` function is used to split the text into an array of words, and `length(lines)` is the sum of the lengths of all the words that have already been added to the current line. The `join` function is then used to join the lines back into a string with newline characters between them.
